meanings.definition: The part of the cerebral cortex concerned with sight and hearing in mammals, regarded as the most recently evolved part of the cortex.
meanings.sent1: The neocortexes help animals see and hear things around them.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the neocortexes to understand how mammals process visual and auditory information.
meanings.sent3: The neocortexes of the brain were having a debate on who had the better view: the eyes or the ears.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a garden, with the neocortexes blooming like colorful flowers of perception.
meanings.sent5: The neocortexes, like vigilant sentinels, stood guard over the realm of senses.

meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the neocortexes of various animals.
meanings.sent2: The neocortexes in mammals play a crucial role in processing sensory information.
meanings.sent3: The neocortexes gathered for their annual meeting to discuss advancements in perception.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the neocortexes were like a bustling city, each neuron a busy citizen.
meanings.sent5: The neocortexes whispered secrets of the world to the attentive brain.
